comment.author: 69005233@N00
comment._content: Name: George W Detrick Age at enlistment: 22 Enlistment Date: 6 May 1861 Rank at enlistment: Private State Served: Ohio Survived the War?: No Service Record: Enlisted in Company F, Ohio 23rd Infantry Regiment on 05 Jun 1861. Mustered out [killed] on 14 Sep 1862 at South Mountain, MD. Birth Date: abt 1839 Sources: Official Roster of the Soldiers of the State of Ohio The Bivouacs of the Dead Roll of Honor of Ohio Soldiers ancestry.com More about the Battle of South Mountain. Interesting, future US president Rutherford B. Hayes was severely wounded in the battle. He was serving in the same unit (23rd Ohio) as Mr. Detrick.
